page.title: 20COMMUNICATIONS IN ROMSLEY
page.content: Main road to Bromsgrove runs east of village.Speed restrict.thro'village 30mph.,40mphto Halesowen and only less than 3tons.Vol.traffic heavy early morning late afternoon;flashing lights and warden for school crossing.Bus service Broms.to Hales.,used in Hales. direction,but almost nil use to Broms. "Branch line from Longbridge to Old Hill,station at Hunnington opened 10th Sept.1883,closed 4th June 1963.Gave a passenger/goods service for local people and later Bluebird.Close by was Dowery Dell Trestle Viaduct.Station now a private house. The lines have been taken but Dad and I have found old pieces of track." Ian Goodwin. Telephone kiosks in Romsley and Hunn. Sub-P.O's in Romsley and Hunnington. British Telecom have an exchange next to Church Hall.Police have radio station at top of Romsley hill.
